course.title: ADM 3317 The Global Context of Business: Merchants, Traders, Capitalists and Profit Seekers (3 units)
course.desc: Examines and evaluates the practices of merchants, traders, entrepreneurs, financiers, marketers and profit seekers of the 15th to the 19th centuries who contributed to the development of global business and trade. Emphasizes the dynamic intertwining of markets and their social, technological, political, economic and cultural context via the analysis and discussion of case studies, readings and other sources.Course Component: LecturePrerequisite: 54 university units including ADM 1100 or ADM 1300, ADM 1101 or ADM 1301, ECO 1102, and ECO 1104.
